text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with pinot glazed mushrooms a
topping for burgers so here's what we
did we took some brown butter we've done
that before you put butter in a pan on
medium low heat until it turns a very
light nutty brown once it turns that
color I'm gonna throw in a big handful
of brown mushrooms with a pinch of salt
and on medium heat we're gonna cook that
until nicely browned and of course I'm
just using regular brown mushrooms but
this will work with any mushroom wild or
domestic by the way these little brown
mushrooms
those are baby portobellos if you let
these grow they grow into portabellas
true story why would I make up stuff
about mushrooms come on so take your
time you really want to cook the
mushrooms well before we add our wine we
really want to get all that flavor less
moisture evaporating up out of the
mushroom so we can replace it with
flavor at this point I'm gonna hit it
with a little black pepper and then the
star of the show a little Pinot and know
our pardon my french any lighter red
wine will work so I'm gonna throw a
splash in and then I'm gonna be very
very careful because of the alcohol
content wine and other liquors will
evaporate much faster than water out of
a pan like this all right so when you
pour it in do not walk away stand there
and enjoy the evaporation it's only
gonna take a minute by the way because
we sauteed these first the mushrooms
soaked in that brown butter and not only
did it make the mushrooms delicious but
it kind of made them waterproof so now
this wine instead of totally soaking
into the mushroom more so glazes the
outside and it is a fantastic burger
topping and by the way fYI this is kind
of a tease I'm going to be doing an
amazing burger recipe using these
mushrooms and a few weeks stay tuned for
that you're going to be blown away
anyway if you like sauteed mushrooms on
burgers you're definitely gonna wanna
give this a try go to food wishes calm
for all the ingredient amounts as usual
and as always enjoy
